column4: I'm installing Ubuntu Gutsy 7.10 Server and I'm running into a problem wiht the DHCP network autoconfiguration
This is a pretty dumb question... but, how can I find out if I have a DHCP network?
I'm pretty sure that the answer is "if you have to ask, you don't have one"
Or, "I'm doing this at my house, so it's likely I don't have one"
do you have a router?
do you have to set up ip numbers manually?
Nope, they are automatically assigned
well, THIS is dhcp.
yes. but remember, there has to be a cable conection.
Do you mean that the box must be wired to the router?
yes
try a cable while installing.
10-4, thanks. It's odd that it supports a wireless connection, though, but whatever I can do
If it doesn't work, can I continue on and just not configure the network at this time? I do want this computer to be a wireless server
you will need the network connection for installing
OK, then I'll wire and set it up for a wireless connection later
Thanks, if I continue to have problems, you know I'll come back ;)
np. be right back
does it work now?
No, it doesn't
I'm still trying to figure it out, but right now I'm doing some manual labor >.<
I inserted a cable and tried to connect again, yes
